text: Kirkby Bentinck railway station is a former station on the Great Central Railway on the section from Nottingham Victoria to Sheffield Victoria. The station was opened in March 1893 and closed in March 1963 after only 60 years in service. ==Present day== Nothing remains of Kirkby Bentinck station apart from two concrete poles that held the station sign and the station master’s house on Church Hill. The site is now grazed and used for agriculture. ==References== ==Former services== Category:Former Great Central Railway stations
title: Kirkby Bentinck railway station
